Att ha flugor i magen: Att bita i det sura äpplet
to have butterflies in stomach: to bite the bullet

to have butterflies in stomach: to kill two birds with one stone

Att ha flugor i magen: Att ha rent mjöl i påsen
to have butterflies in stomach: to have a clean conscience
to be completely wrong
to keep fingers crossed
to be on the ball
to catch red-handed
to put a spoke in the wheel
to keep cool under pressure
to be flesh and blood
to hit the nail on the head
to be in the same boat

Att ha flugor i magen: Att dra sitt strå till stacken
to have butterflies in stomach: to do one's bit

Att ha flugor i magen: Att ha ett finger med i spelet
to have butterflies in stomach: to have a finger in the pie
to be afraid for one's life
to take the bull by the horns
to throw in the towel

Att ha flugor i magen: Att vara som natt och dag
to have butterflies in stomach: to be like night and day

Att ha flugor i magen: Att ha många strängar på sin lyra
to have butterflies in stomach: to have many strings to one's bow
to be an open book

Att ha flugor i magen: Att sälja skinnet innan björnen är skjuten
to have butterflies in stomach: to count chickens before they hatch

Att ha flugor i magen: Att gå som katten kring het gröt
to have butterflies in stomach: to beat around the bush
to be on edge

Att ha flugor i magen: Det är ingen ko på isen
to have butterflies in stomach: there's no cow on the ice (no problem)
to have bats in the belfry
to be dead and buried

Att ha flugor i magen: Att komma som en tjuv om natten

to be wet behind the ears

to have rubbish in the skull

Att ha flugor i magen: Att vara som tupp i korg

to be sick in the head

Att ha flugor i magen: Att vara som hund och katt
to have butterflies in stomach: to fight like cats and dogs
to taste blood
to be for real
to have one's hands full
to be slipping away
to get a taste for something
to be completely out of it
to have meat on the bones

to play fair
